divs: sighting detailsi am a captain with a large us airline. this event occurred back in the early 90's and the exact time, place, date are approximate. i always wondered what i'd observed but never said anything due to my job, my reputation, and the fact that i wasn't sure what i really saw that day. it wasn't until today, when i happened upon a soviet mig 21 film that showed them chasing an object exactly like the one i saw, that i decided to tell someone about it. i was a first officer on a md-80 aircraft flying across the midwest eastbound to chicago. it was the middle of the afternoon, early fall, and there were numerous scattered to broken cloud decks below us, and a higher stratus deck above. i think we were still in cruise flight, somewhere between 31000 to 35000 feet, somewhere over kansas or missouri. i remember it being not a bright day, sort of broken overcast as far as illumination goes. not a bright day, but not gray or gloomy. the captain and i both noticed a black dot quite a ways ahead of us to the left, and lower. i think i made a comment about it, as it was a habit to call out any air traffic when we noticed it. both of us watched as the object came closer; our interest increasing mostly because it's coloring was so dark and it stood out quite well against the white puffy clouds below and ahead of us. as we approached, we could see that it wasn't another jet as we expected, but instead could clearly see a long, flat-black cylinder with squared off ends, maybe 3-5000 feet below us and traveling slowly in the opposite direction. it looked to be as large, or perhaps slightly longer and thicker than our aircraft. there were no markings or openings that i could see. both of us were sort of stunned by it's shape, mostly because of it's size and the fact that the ends were squared off and it appeared to be moving. my initial reaction was that it was some sort of odd balloon, but somehow moving at speed opposite the jet stream. it passed behind us to our left and below, rather quickly. it seem to maintain the same speed, not accelerating or slowing. we queried atc about other traffic or weather balloons in our vicinity but they told us they had nothing on their scopes. both of us looked at each other and i think made some nervous jokes about what we had just seen, but due to a sort of unspoken creed of our profession, neither of us said much about it after that... i think more due to the fact that it was such an odd shape that neither wanted to bring up the "ufo" theory, at least not seriously. i had never heard of a ufo shaped like a cylinder before. i have been a pilot for 35+ years, 19 years at this airline ( the last 6 years as captain), and a military pilot for 10 years prior to that. i am not one of those guys wearing a tin foil hat and seeing the mother ship in every cloud. i would best be described as a skeptic, until now. we don't talk publicly about these sorts of things. i have only mentioned this quietly to one or two people since that time, and only as one of those stories where you couldn't figure out what you saw. it wasn't until today, when i saw that mig 21 video on the internet that i was shocked back to that moment, literally stunned, and realized that the object in the video was the exact same thing i had witnessed. it bothered me enough to report it to you, though i doubt it will help much since it was so long ago and my details are a bit fuzzy. i hope you will keep my name, email and phone numbers confidential. my company would definitely frown on this being connected to me or their company. this is the link to the video: http:\\video.google.ca\videoplay?docid=-4468185100897567649
